content.question: Three ramps, <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, have the dimensions shown in the figure. Identical blocks are released from rest at the top of each of the three ramps and slide to the bottom. The coefficient of kinetic friction between each of block and ramp is the same. Which of the following correctly ranks the speeds of the blocks at the bottom of the ramps?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub A equals v sub A, which equals v sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub B is less than v sub A, which equals v sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub A equals v sub B, which is less than v sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub B is less than v sub A, which is less than v sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub B is less than v sub A, which is less than v sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
